body.name: The Saint's Magic Power Is Omnipotent (Light Novel), Vol. 6
body.description: Potions and PoliticsSei's life has just returned to a semblance of normal when she's once more summoned to the palace. A foreign prince is coming to the kingdom, ostensibly to study abroad, but his true intentions are shrouded in mystery. In order to protect Sei, the kingdom instructs her to hide her true identity as the Saint and retreat to the safety of the palace. While she complies at first, she soon finds herself drawn to the prince—especially when it becomes clear that she might be the only person who can help him. Read more

productInformation.name: Publisher

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars kicking, screaming, giggling
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely adore this series and to see Sei and Alberts relationship grow makes me giggle and want to kick my feet from how adorable they are.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Slow burn slice of life, but more of the same
reviews.reviewText: Personally I enjoy reading the story, Sei's research into new potions and interactions with those around her, but it feels much the same like previous volumes. The only romantic development were in the short stories at the end or the behind the scene one about the ball in the previous volume. So if you enjoy these slice-of-life slow burners, you will enjoy the book. Still, I do hope the romance at least is going somewhere...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars this is good
reviews.reviewText: I was expecting more and that’s what I got. The behind the scenes chapters are really insightful because the reader’s get to know why some of the things happened. I can’t wait to see what all of those around Sei do.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I've read quite a few "isekai" novels and so far, this series is one of the few that was written really well. The world building and characters are done consistently in a way that others fail to do. Granted it's not constant action, but I love the way the plot moves along. Plus, the anime for this series is consistent with the novel thankfully so it's honestly worth the read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Loved volume six, lots of the usual romance, fantasy, drama, and suspense. It’s nice reading about Sei and Albert as their relationship progresses and they grow more intimate towards each other with each volume.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Definitely recommend the whole series to read. They are all lovely and cute. The translation is very well done. Look forward to reading more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Spinning Its Wheels
reviews.reviewText: I genuinely think the author hit a wall after the Klausner Domain arc ended. Now that Sei is recognized as the Saint in the Kingdom and she has full control over her saint powers, there's nothing more for the story to tell. Good stories need conflict and this story has none. Now that monsters aren't a threat anymore the author doesn't seem to know what to do. There's the illusion of a "conflict" in this light novel where Sei has to hide her Saint powers from a foreign prince while helping him, but we're not provided any reasonable justification for why that's necessary. Who cares if the foreign prince knows Sei is the Saint? There's zero tension or stakes involved. Even when after 2/3rds of the way in the story we get some actual stakes with a progressive disease, it's for a character we do not meet nor spend any time with.And once again we have what little might have made for compelling storytelling being relegated to the "behind the scenes" section of the light novel where any potential drama is wrapped up without Sei knowing about it. Only this time it's even worse because the behind the scenes chapter in this light novel is for an event in the previous light novel. Making readers have to jump to that story if they want to follow the series of events in chronological order.The one area of the story that could see tangible forward progression, Sei's love life with Albert, again goes absolutely nowhere.Skip this light novel. Like the one before it, it feels completely like a side story that does nothing to further the overall narrative. If there even is an "overall narrative" at this point. The story seems to have logically concluded with Sei being recognized as the Saint.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: A good story. I love the way the main character still has her personal charm. It is fun to read
